body.name: Hell Mode, Volume 3
body.description: How is "No-life Gamers" as a party name?The Academy City arc starts off with a bang! After leaving the service of House Granvelle, Allen enrolls in the Academy together with Cecil, as well as Krena and Dogora who have come all the way from Krena Village. As part of their new life together, they form a party to take on the many dungeons scattered throughout Academy City, keeping in mind their ultimate goal of defeating the Demon Lord. When Allen goes in search of a healer for their party, he encounters Keel, a boy his age with the Cleric Talent.However, Keel comes across as guarded and reticent. Just what secret is he hiding, and how is it related to House Granvelle? At the same time, why is Helmios, the Hero of Giamut, at the Academy, and what does he want from Allen? And what's this about a martial arts tournament? Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is now my favorite book series of all time
reviews.reviewText: There are simply no words for how this book and all the previous ones have captivated me. They've made me dream again. They've returned the childlike wonder I had at stories of fantasy.This series is a slow progression, but every stride, every achievement that our protagonist makes feels nothing short of completing a major quest. You know the feeling as a gamer... the sense of accomplishment and pride at having overcome a great trial. It boggles my mind how the author manages to create that feeling over and over for me.Book 3 in the series Hell Mode brings our party to Academy City for the military academy arc, if you could call it that. It's packed with action, pog gamer moments, and Allen's shenanigans and plans to overcome the gruesome, seemingly never-ending requirements to level up in Hell Mode.I thank the author for this amazing series, and I will continue to voraciously devour every volume that comes out. Thank you for entertaining me so thoroughly and for creating a series that has inspired me to one day write my own series like this one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Keeps getting better!
reviews.reviewText: Every time I read/re read this story, I am simply amazed at the sheer level of detail and characterization that has gone into it. It’s one of, if not, my favorite series to date; and I watch and read a lot of media. I honestly can’t wait until this is animated. I truly wish it gets picked up. Phenomenal story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I think this is my favorite volume so far, and it looks like it's time to go to war im looking forward to that

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Good overall however it seemed a bit rushed good but not as good as vol 1-2 overall would recommend. calzone

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The story is so funny, although a bit technical at times it still keeps you entertained. I really enjoyed this story!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great binge read
reviews.reviewText: Finally took the time to wind down with that after story to take the time to review the book, I breezed through the first two without stopping.Loving the attitudes, how scaling works, and the analytical process Allen has and also loving the gradual exposing of the lore and how natural it feels (for it's game-like setting)Definitely going to be voraciously tearing through the last volumes and eagerly wait for more!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Not another recreating food isekai, actual plot!
reviews.reviewText: Let me start off saying that I don’t like writing reviews (actually go out of my way to avoid them) but I believe this was worth the effort.Are you looking for an iseaki that doesn’t involve recreating food, a harem or lazy plot details? Are you looking for something that doesn’t devolve into a DragonBall Z-esque drag on lengths of battles? Are you tired of MC’s that are oblivious or creepers? The main character doesn’t try to change the world (intentionally) to reflect his old world and just enjoyable to be around. We finally get to see a glimmer of how the main character is different than those in “normal mode” and it’s refreshing.Overall a great read that doesn’t involve you suspending your disbelief or morals to enjoy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I've had mixed luck with light novels... the authors usually seem to focus on 'cute' or nonsensical romance ignoring the main story line.Hell Mode has impressed me by the maturity of the story telling. There is depth to the characters that have clear goals and motivations while working in a much larger world with challenges and clear objective.I would definitely recommend this series! Looking forward to the next book!

Hell mode vol 3 is a good read however could use some polish. I feel the flow of information was lacking in this volume. I am also concerned about where the story is going to go. Based on how the stakes and world is set up

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 17, 2022
reviews.reviewText: The Academy arc continues to impress i like the fight scenes as well as how the mc protects and helps his family! the backstory of helmios is also a much apreciated adition.

Behold a serie with an academy arc which does not last forever, where young nobles are not arrogant young masters waiting for the usual cliche to happen.It has its strengths but its weaknesses are kinda disappointing, it s not that I want this arc to last longer but it goes too fast I Don t think that any important thing is being ignored we could call it efficient but social interactions are reduced to a bare minimum we only get a basic (and a bit cliché? (it s efficient that it is) plot for one of the new characters.Some Occasional comic reliefs with the known cast and it s not bad considering "all the characters there is" and how much the story does manage to progress in. Single volume. To do that however we get most of the time a faraway point of view which sums up things that happened for long periods of time slowing only from time to time before speeding up and getting further up from the plot again.On the good side of things it s not bad or anything and we avoid a 2 volume arc with unnecessary lengths, I just hope it does t become a habit.Also still takes the time to be a bit edgy at times.Not a bad read or anything, but it went from a surprise which made we want to read what came next as soon as it came to a somewhat decent isekai who will not always go for the cliché, which I will probably not drop but that I no longer look forward to.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 18, 2022
reviews.reviewText: More summong. reaching the level cap and how to progress after it, as well as fights against what is considered the strongest on the alliance side so the reader can gauge the strength levels of the characters.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 20, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: Darker isekai, Remains true to the title
reviews.reviewText: Had to read this as the premises was intriguing. Hope the characters develop more. Still fun to read. Just how messed up is this world.
